problem_text: Find x. Round to the nearest tenth.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: AD = CD, 32 = AD, BC, ∠ADB, AB ⊥ BD, AB, AD, BC ⊥ BD, x = AB, ∠DCA, ∠BAD, 3.14 = pi, BD, B on AC, AC, CD, pi * (54 / 180) = ∠DCB, ∠CAD, tan(∠BAD), y = BD, cos(∠BAD)

Step 2:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : BC ⊥ BD
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠CBD

Step 3:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 0.94 = pi * (54 / 180)

Step 4:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : AB, BD, AD
Conclusions: △ABD

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : B on AC, ∠DCA
Conclusions: ∠DCA = ∠DCB

Step 6:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : CD, AC, AD
Conclusions: △ACD

Step 7:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : CD, BC, BD
Conclusions: △BCD

Step 8:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : B on AC, ∠CAD
Conclusions: ∠BAD = ∠CAD

Step 9:
Theorem: Angle Tan Definition
Premises : AB ⊥ BD, tan(∠BAD)
Conclusions: BD / AB = tan(∠BAD)

Step 10:
Theorem: Angle Cos Definition
Premises : cos(∠BAD), AB ⊥ BD
Conclusions: AB / AD = cos(∠BAD)

Step 11:
Theorem: Cos Function Definition
Premises : ∠ADB, △ABD, AB ⊥ BD
Conclusions: BD / AD = cos(∠ADB)

Step 12:
Theorem: Cos Function Definition
Premises : △ABD, AB ⊥ BD, ∠BAD
Conclusions: AB / AD = cos(∠BAD)

Step 13:
Theorem: Sin Function Definition
Premises : ∠ADB, △ABD, AB ⊥ BD
Conclusions: AB / AD = sin(∠ADB)

Step 14:
Theorem: Perimeter Definition
Premises : △ABD
Conclusions: Perimeter(△ABD) = AB + AD + BD

Step 15:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DCA = ∠DCB, pi * (54 / 180) = ∠DCB
Conclusions: pi * (54 / 180) = ∠DCA

Step 16:
Theorem: Issoceles Triangle Theorem
Premises : △ACD, AD = CD
Conclusions: BC ⊥ BD, ∠ADB = ∠BDC, AB ⊥ BD, AB = BC

Step 17:
Theorem: Issoceles Triangle Property
Premises : △ACD, AD = CD
Conclusions: ∠CAD = ∠DCA

Step 18:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(D, C, B)
Premises : △BCD
Conclusions: pi = ∠BDC + ∠CBD + ∠DCB

Step 19:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : AB / AD = cos(∠BAD), AB / AD = cos(∠BAD)
Conclusions: AB / AD = AB / AD

Step 20:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (54 / 180) = ∠DCA, 0.94 = pi * (54 / 180)
Conclusions: 0.94 = ∠DCA

Step 21:
Theorem: Side-Side-Side Congruent Theorem
Premises : AD = CD, AB = BC
Conclusions: △ABD ≅ △CBD

Step 22:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : pi = ∠BDC + ∠CBD + ∠DCB, pi / 2 = ∠CBD, 3.14 = pi, pi * (54 / 180) = ∠DCB
Conclusions: 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + 3.14 * (54 / 180) + ∠BDC

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : AB / AD = AB / AD, AB / AD = sin(∠ADB)
Conclusions: AB / AD = sin(∠ADB)

Step 24:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 0.94 = ∠DCA, ∠CAD = ∠DCA
Conclusions: 0.94 = ∠CAD

Step 25:
Theorem: Congruent Definition
Premises : △ABD ≅ △CBD
Conclusions: Perimeter(△ABD) = Perimeter(△BCD), ∠ADB = ∠BDC

Step 26:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + 3.14 * (54 / 180) + ∠BDC
Conclusions: 0.63 = ∠BDC

Step 27:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BAD = ∠CAD, 0.94 = ∠CAD
Conclusions: 0.94 = ∠BAD

Step 28:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : Perimeter(△ABD) = Perimeter(△BCD), 32 = AD, Perimeter(△ABD) = AB + AD + BD, y = BD, x = AB
Conclusions: 32 + x + y = Perimeter(△BCD)

Step 29:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ADB = ∠BDC, 0.63 = ∠BDC
Conclusions: 0.63 = ∠ADB

Step 30:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 0.94 = ∠BAD
Conclusions: 1.38 = tan(∠BAD)

Step 31:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 32 + x + y = Perimeter(△BCD), Perimeter(△ABD) = Perimeter(△BCD)
Conclusions: 32 + x + y = Perimeter(△ABD)

Step 32:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : y = BD, 0.63 = ∠ADB, BD / AD = cos(∠ADB), 32 = AD
Conclusions: cos(0.63) = y / 32

Step 33:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 32 = AD, x = AB, 0.63 = ∠ADB, AB / AD = sin(∠ADB)
Conclusions: sin(0.63) = x / 32

Step 34:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 0.63 = ∠ADB
Conclusions: 0.59 = sin(∠ADB)

Step 35:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : BD / AB = tan(∠BAD), 1.38 = tan(∠BAD)
Conclusions: 1.38 = BD / AB

Step 36:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 32 + x + y = Perimeter(△ABD), Perimeter(△ABD) = AB + AD + BD
Conclusions: 32 + x + y = AB + AD + BD

Step 37:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 0.59 = sin(∠ADB), AB / AD = sin(∠ADB)
Conclusions: 0.59 = AB / AD

Step 38:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : cos(0.63) = y / 32, sin(0.63) = x / 32, 32 + x + y = AB + AD + BD, 1.38 = BD / AB, 0.59 = AB / AD
Conclusions: 18.81 = AB

Step 39:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 18.81 = AB, x = AB
Conclusions: 18.81 = x
